snippet: Yelp, the customer-reviews Web site, said it had signed up more advertisers in the second quarter and was raising its full-year revenue forecast.

headline.main: Yelp Revenue Rises 67%, and Loss Is Lower Than Expected
headline.print_headline: Yelp Revenue Rises 67%, and Loss Is Lower Than Expected

snippet: A spam attack on Dropbox users has been linked to a password stolen in a breach on another Web site. Dropbox declined to say which company's breach was responsible. But the attack illustrates a common tactic used by hackers.
abstract: A spam attack on Dropbox users has been linked to a password stolen in a breach on another Web site. Dropbox declined to say which company's breach was responsible. But the attack illustrates a common tactic used by hackers.

headline.main: Dropbox Spam Attack Tied to Stolen Employee Password

snippet: When Apple acquired AuthenTec last week, neither company issued a statement or a news release on the deal, which underscores the hard bargaining tactics of the technology giant.
abstract: When Apple acquired AuthenTec last week, neither company issued a statement or a news release on the deal, which underscores the hard bargaining tactics of the technology giant.

snippet: Apple's now-defunct MobileMe service may have left the iDisk icon behind, but you can remove it.
abstract: Apple's now-defunct MobileMe service may have left the iDisk icon behind, but you can remove it.

headline.main: Q&A: Cleaning Up the Mac's Sidebar

snippet: Q.     Apple killed off the service, but I still have this iDisk icon in the list of drives in my Mac's window. It gives me an error every time I accidentally click on it, so can I just remove it?
abstract: Personal Tech Q&A column on removing the iDisk icon from the Mac's sidebar. (S)h

snippet: EXCHANGE DEAL The Maple Group, a consortium of Canadian financial firms and pension funds, has acquired 91 percent of the shares in the TMX Group, securing its $3.7 billion buyout of the Canadian exchange operator.      Wednesday's announcement en...
abstract: DealBook Online; Maple Group acquires 91 percent of the TMX Group, securing its $3.7 billion buyout; Credit Suisse names David DeNunzio as global chairman of its mergers and acquisitions group; Apple's proposed $356 million acquisition of AuthenTec is unusual because of how little AuthenTec is saying about the deal. snippet: Since the implosion of the dot-com bubble in 2000, retail investors have been rightfully wary of the stock market. Facebook was going to change it all, bringing the ordinary investor back.     Instead, Facebook was a massacre for retail investors,...
abstract: Steven M Davidoff Deal Professor column on the disappointing performance of Facebook's stock says it is yet another example of how the average investor consistently loses out whey they buy and trade individual shares of a company. Drawing (M)1

headline.main: In Picking Facebook Shares, Repeating the Past's Mistakes
